title: Sparkle

nouns: Sphere of plasma held together by gravity, undergoing fusion
A luminous celestial body that is made from gases (particularly hydrogen and helium) and forms the shape of a sphere.
This article is for quotes about stars, or which make prominent mention of stars.
(astronomy) a celestial body of hot gases that radiates energy derived from thermonuclear reactions in the interior
A star is a massive, luminous sphere of plasma held together by its own gravity.
A luminous celestial body, made up of plasma (particularly hydrogen and helium) and having a spherical shape. Depending on context the sun may or may not be included.
A steady bright blue light; formerly used as a signal but now a firework
A bright blue flare, formerly used in signalling, but now chiefly as fireworks.
Fireworks are a class of explosive pyrotechnic devices used for aesthetic, cultural, and religious purposes.
Such as firecrackers, bottle rockets, bang snaps and others
An event or a display where fireworks are set off.

description:
Often used as a decorative bullet-point, the sparkle has both a ❇︎ text and ❇️ emoji presentation available on most platforms.

Like with the ✨ Sparkles emoji, an icon similar to the four-point star design used to represent this emoji by several vendors (e.g. Apple, Microsoft) is often used within tech platforms to represent a feature that utilizes artificial intelligence.
apple_vendor_description: The sparkle emoji on Apple devices is a brilliant, multi-pointed starburst, radiating with a vibrant, almost effervescent glow. Its design features crisp, sharp points contrasted with soft, rounded highlights that capture realistic light reflections, a hallmark of Apple's detailed 3D rendering. This emoji on Apple devices is frequently used to add emphasis, excitement, or a touch of magic to text, signifying something special, new, or dazzling.
